titleStmt.title: Letter from James H. Jensen to John G. Neihardt, May 17, 1967
titleStmt.author: Jensen, James H.

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.author: Jensen, James H.
bibl.title: Letter from James H. Jensen to John Neihardt

keywords.term: The Song of the Indian Wars

revisionDesc.change: Styles, Ryan Transcription and Initial Encoding

div1.fw:
Oregon State University
Office of the President
Corvallis, Oregon 97331
div1.p: Sometime ago, when visiting my son in Omaha, my attention was directed to a statement in the Omaha World-Herald which described an honor accorded you by Warren Methodist Church of Lincoln. I was thrilled to read the article and to see your picture. Your writings and particularly "The Song of Three Friends" have been constant companions of mine. In 1926, when I was a sophomore at the University of Nebraska, your trilogy, "The Songs of the Indian Wars" etc., were used for class exercises.

I am sure you receive many communications and I have wished for some years to express my appreciation to you for your writings and for the many hours of pleasure and stimulation that your poetry has provided me. I am delighted that you have received a "notable Nebraska award" bearing the citation "Nebraska Poet of the Century." May you continue to enjoy good health, vigor and happiness.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours,
James H. Jensen James H. Jensen,
President.
